abstract: The new guidelines for monitoring executive pay may still leave too much to the discretion of banks, many of which used their bailouts for bonuses.
snippet: The new guidelines for monitoring executive pay may still leave too much to the discretion of banks, many of which used their bailouts for bonuses.
lead_paragraph: In 2009, there was a lot of talk about reasonable limits on bankers’ compensation, after some breathtakingly risky lending almost crippled the financial system. A czar was appointed. Politicians said the bankers had better not use their bailouts for bonuses.

abstract: UCI International, a supplier of replacement parts for light and heavy-duty vehicles, is looking to raise as much as $200 million in an initial public offering, Renaissance Capital reported.
snippet: UCI International, a supplier of replacement parts for light and heavy-duty vehicles, is looking to raise as much as $200 million in an initial public offering, Renaissance Capital reported.
lead_paragraph: UCI International, a supplier of replacement parts for light and heavy-duty vehicles, is looking to raise as much as $200 million in an initial public offering, Renaissance Capital reported.

headline.main: Carlyle’s UCI International Eyes $200 Million I.P.O.

abstract: Banks had trouble raising money to lend in the aftermath of the sovereign debt crisis, the European Central Bank said.
snippet: Banks had trouble raising money to lend in the aftermath of the sovereign debt crisis, the European Central Bank said.
lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT  Business loans were harder to come by in the second quarter of 2010, the European Central Bank said Wednesday, as banks themselves had trouble raising money to lend to customers.

headline.main: Lending Tightened in 2nd Quarter for Businesses in Europe
headline.print_headline: Lending Tightened in 2nd Quarter for Businesses in Europe
